title.narrative: Protection emergency response to affected population caused by the eruption of the de Fuego volcano

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide protection support to people affected by the Volcan de Fuego eruption. UNHCR will use CERF funds to distribute protection kits to 850 families, including shelter tool kits, tarpaulins, mosquito nets and jerrycans. 4,250 beneficiaries will benefit from this project, which will be implemented within three months.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Protection emergency response to affected population caused by the eruption of the de Fuego volcano

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS GUATEMALA RAPID RESPONSE VOLCANO 2018

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Support families that were displaced with the volcano with basic items that will improve their immediate living conditions and mitigate protection risks in the shelters.
# of vulnerable families identified and supported through protection kits
